intro: Sorocea carautana, commonly known as the Caraután sorocea, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Sorocea carautana is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
